# 🌿 A 10-cm Fix: Rewetting to Save Peat Carbon

**Author:** *Rahmat Hidayat*  
**Affiliation:** IPB University / National Research and Innovation Agency (BRIN), Indonesia

---

# 🧭 Abstract

Indonesia’s tropical peatlands store nearly half of the world’s tropical peat carbon but are highly sensitive to water table fluctuations, making them vulnerable to climate variability and drainage.  

This study quantifies the impacts of **El Niño–Southern Oscillation (ENSO)** events and **canal water level (CWL) management** on **peat water table depth (WTD)** and **carbon emissions** in *Ogan Komering Ilir, South Sumatra*.  

Using daily **ERA5 rainfall and temperature data (2001–2024)**, we simulated WTD at high spatial and temporal resolution and assessed carbon loss under different hydrological scenarios.  
🌞 **El Niño years deepened WTD by ~10 cm**, increasing annual peat carbon loss by **~27%** compared to baseline conditions.  
💧 **Rewetting**, achieved by maintaining *CWL +10 cm* during dry seasons, reduced carbon loss by approximately **1.0 tC ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹ (~3.67 tCO₂ ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹)**, delivering potential economic benefits of **USD 13.4–257.8 million annually**, depending on carbon market prices.

> “Modest, targeted rewetting is an effective and cost-efficient Nature-Based Solution (NbS) to mitigate greenhouse gas emissions and enhance peatland resilience.”

### Key Findings
- 🌞 El Niño deepened WTD by **~5–9 cm**, increasing carbon losses by up to **~12.87 tC ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹ (~27%)**  
- 🌧️ La Niña maintained shallower WTDs, reducing emissions  
- 🔄 ENSO-driven hydroclimatic variability accelerates peat carbon loss

---

# 💧 Scenario: Canal Water Level (CWL) Rewetting

<div class="figure">
  <img src="figures/figure3_rewetting.png" alt="CWL rewetting">
  <div class="caption">Figure 3. Mitigation potential of targeted canal water level rewetting (+10 cm).</div>
</div>

| Metric | Value |
|:----------------------------|:------------------------------:|
| **CWL Adjustment** | +10 cm during dry season |
| **Reduced Carbon Loss** | ~1.0 tC ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹ (~3.67 tCO₂ ha⁻¹ yr⁻¹) |
| **Avoided Emissions (1M ha)** | ~3.68 MtCO₂ yr⁻¹ |
| **Economic Value** | USD 13.4 – 257.8 million yr⁻¹ |

> 💡 *Small hydrological adjustments can yield large-scale climate mitigation and financial benefits.*

---

# 🌏 Key Takeaways

- **Nature-based rewetting** strengthens peatland and climate resilience.  
- **Low-cost CWL management** delivers measurable emission reductions.  
- **Economic and ecological co-benefits** make rewetting a viable climate strategy.
